categories.title: Must-Read Papers
categories.description: Foundational papers that shaped modern AI

items.title: Attention Is All You Need
items.description: The transformer paper that started the LLM revolution.

items.title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers
items.description: Bidirectional transformers for NLP. Changed pre-training paradigm.

items.title: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners
items.description: GPT-3 paper. Demonstrated emergent abilities at scale.

items.title: LoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models
items.description: Efficient fine-tuning by adding small trainable matrices.

items.title: Chain-of-Thought Prompting
items.description: Improve reasoning by asking models to think step-by-step.

items.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive Tasks
items.description: Combine retrieval with generation for factual accuracy.

items.title: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
items.description: Skip connections enabling very deep networks. ImageNet breakthrough.

items.title: Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
items.description: Foundation of modern image generation (DALL-E, Stable Diffusion).

items.title: Training language models to follow instructions (InstructGPT)
items.description: RLHF to align models with human preferences. Led to ChatGPT.

items.title: LLaMA: Open and Efficient Foundation Language Models
items.description: Open-source LLM that sparked the open model revolution.

items.title: Mixtral of Experts
items.description: Sparse mixture of experts achieving state-of-the-art efficiency.

items.title: FlashAttention: Fast and Memory-Efficient Attention
items.description: IO-aware attention algorithm enabling longer contexts.

items.title: Direct Preference Optimization
items.description: Simpler alternative to RLHF for aligning language models.

items.title: Constitutional AI
items.description: Training harmless AI assistants using self-improvement.

items.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models
items.description: Foundational work on how LLM performance scales with compute.

items.title: Training Compute-Optimal Large Language Models (Chinchilla)
items.description: Optimal compute allocation between model size and data.

items.title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision (CLIP)
items.description: Connecting text and images for zero-shot classification.

items.title: An Image is Worth 16x16 Words (Vision Transformer)
items.description: Applying transformers directly to image patches.

items.title: GPT-4 Technical Report
items.description: Technical report on GPT-4's capabilities and limitations.

items.title: Gemini: A Family of Highly Capable Multimodal Models
items.description: Google's multimodal AI model technical report.

items.title: ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting in Language Models
items.description: Combining reasoning and actions for LLM agents.

items.title: Toolformer: Language Models Can Teach Themselves to Use Tools
items.description: Teaching LLMs to use external tools autonomously.

items.title: Mamba: Linear-Time Sequence Modeling with Selective State Spaces
items.description: State space model alternative to transformers with linear complexity.

items.title: Retentive Network: A Successor to Transformer for Large Language Models
items.description: Retention mechanism combining training parallelism with inference efficiency.

items.title: Tree of Thoughts: Deliberate Problem Solving with Large Language Models
items.description: Structured reasoning through exploration of thought trees.

items.title: Self-Instruct: Aligning Language Models with Self-Generated Instructions
items.description: Generating instruction data from LLMs for fine-tuning.

items.title: QLoRA: Efficient Finetuning of Quantized LLMs
items.description: Fine-tune 65B models on single GPU with 4-bit quantization.

items.title: Visual Instruction Tuning (LLaVA)
items.description: Training vision-language models with GPT-4 generated data.

items.title: Robust Speech Recognition via Large-Scale Weak Supervision
items.description: Whisper speech recognition trained on 680K hours of audio.

items.description: State-of-the-art NLP models. 200K+ models in hub.
